TopicTitle: What are the different F10 overlay settings supposed to show?

Articles.Content: Before you could toggle Temperature Gauges on/off with the F10 key. Since 1.0.5 (I think) when you hit F10 you toggle through four different modes (something like) : Gauges on, Gauges off, Gauges off with Highlights, Gauges on with Highlights. But I couldn't see any differences between Gauges on and Gauges on with Highlights. What is it I should see highlighted? (I tried it while my vessel was overheating a lot of parts.) Edited November 26, 2015 by egoego

F10 toggles the thermal gauges only. F11 toggles the thermal overlay, which shades parts based on temperatire (red=cooler, yellow=hotter). F12 toggles the aero overlay, which visualizes the aero forces on each part.

Oh, I already know what the F11 and F12 overlays do. And until recently I tought I knew what F10 did. But since 1.0.5 the F10 key cycles through 4 different texts, but I am not sure if they work as planed, as I can't spot a difference (exept gauges off and on). Am I the only one seeing 4 modes instead of 2 on the F10 key?

Exactly the same here. [key]F10[/key] cycles through the four options but no matter which the fugly highlight stays visible. I still wonder why it's there in the first place. I can live with the gauges but the glow is completely unrealistic.

There's two separate 'glow' things.
1. Parts highlight at the same color as their gauge, if Highlighting is turned on.
2. [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Draper_point]Parts begin to glow (emit radiation) at ~798 K.[/url]
Thank you for your answers. I guess my ships just hadn't been hot enough to see those extra highlights then.
